member.name: P:BlazingStory.Components.BlazingStoryApp.Title
member.summary:
A title string of this Blazing Story app. (The default value is "Blazing Story")
This is used for the title of every HTML document. And also, this is used for the brand logo unless you customize the logo contents using render fragment parameter.

member.name: P:BlazingStory.Components.BlazingStoryApp.DefaultLayout
member.summary: A type of the default layout component to use when displaying a story.

member.name: P:BlazingStory.Components.BlazingStoryApp.BrandLogoArea
member.summary:
Content for the brand logo area at the top of the sidebar.
You can refer to the instance of the component via context argument in the rendered fragment.

member.name: P:BlazingStory.Components.BlazingStoryApp.AvailableColorSchemes
member.summary:
The available color schemes for the Blazing Story.
When the is set, the Blazing Story app will be displayed in light mode only.
When the is set, the Blazing Story app will be displayed in dark mode only.
The default value is , and system preference will be respected.

member.name: P:BlazingStory.Components.BlazingStoryApp.NavigationTreeOrder
member.summary: Specifies a custom order for items in the sidebar navigation tree.
member.remarks:
Provide an ordered sequence of values (typically built with NavigationTreeOrderBuilder.N[ ... ]) to declare the preferred order at each hierarchy level.
Rules:
- Docs and Story items under a component keep their original order and are always listed first.
- Items explicitly listed are placed in the given order. If an item is immediately followed by a group, that group is applied recursively to that item's children.
- Remaining items not covered by the custom order are appended in the default order (alphabetical; components before custom pages).
Example:
@using static BlazingStory.Types.NavigationTreeOrderBuilder
<BlazingStoryApp NavigationTreeOrder="@N["Welcome", "Components", N["Layouts", N["Header", "Footer"], "Button"], "Templates"]" />

member.name: M:BlazingStory.Internals.Models.NavigationTreeItem.SortSubItemsRecurse(System.Collections.Generic.IList{BlazingStory.Types.NavigationTreeOrderEntry})
member.summary: Recursively sorts the sub-items of the current navigation tree item based on the specified custom ordering rules.
member.remarks:
This method processes the sub-items of the current navigation tree item in the following manner:
Items of type or are preserved in their default order and placed before other item types.
Items matching the custom ordering rules are added to the sorted list in the specified order. If a custom ordering specifies sub-items, those sub-items are recursively sorted using the same logic.
Any remaining items not covered by the custom ordering rules are sorted using the default comparer () and appended to the sorted list.
After sorting, the sub-items of the current navigation tree item are replaced with the newly sorted list.
member.param: A list of objects that define the custom ordering rules for sorting. Each ordering specifies the desired sequence of items and sub-items within the navigation tree.

member.name: T:BlazingStory.Internals.Models.QueryRouteData
member.summary: Represents the structured route data of the "path" query string of a URL like "http://.../?path=/story/example-button--primary".

member.name: F:BlazingStory.Internals.Models.QueryRouteData.Path
member.summary:
Gets the "path" query string that is source of this instance.
If a URL like "http://.../?path=/story/example-button--primary" is given, this field will return "/story/example-button--primary".

member.name: F:BlazingStory.Internals.Models.QueryRouteData.View
member.summary:
Gets the first segment of the "path" query string.
If a URL like "http://.../?path=/story/example-button--primary" is given, this field will return "story".

member.name: F:BlazingStory.Internals.Models.QueryRouteData.Parameter
member.summary:
Gets the second segment of the "path" query string.

member.name: F:BlazingStory.Internals.Models.QueryRouteData.RouteToStoryDocsOrCustom
member.summary:
Gets whether the View is "story" or "docs".
If a URL like "http://.../?path=/story/example-button--primary" is given, this field will return true.
If a URL like "http://.../?path=/settings/about" is given, this field will return false.

member.name: T:BlazingStory.Types.NavigationTreeOrderEntry
member.summary:
Represents a node in a navigation tree that can be either:
- an item (leaf) identified by a , or
- a grouping node that contains .
member.remarks: This type behaves like a simple discriminated union. The field indicates which data is meaningful for the instance: - : is populated; is empty. - : contains children; is empty.

member.name: F:BlazingStory.Types.NavigationTreeOrderEntry.Title
member.summary: The display title for an node. For nodes, this value is an empty string.

member.name: F:BlazingStory.Types.NavigationTreeOrderEntry.SubItems
member.summary: The collection of child entries for an node. For nodes, this list is empty.

member.name: T:BlazingStory.Types.NavigationTreeOrderEntry.NodeType
member.summary: Enumerates the possible kinds of nodes represented by .

member.name: F:BlazingStory.Types.NavigationTreeOrderEntry.NodeType.Item
member.summary: A leaf entry that is represented by a .

member.name: F:BlazingStory.Types.NavigationTreeOrderEntry.NodeType.SubItems
member.summary: A grouping entry that contains one or more child entries in .

member.name: F:BlazingStory.Types.NavigationTreeOrderEntry.Type
member.summary: Indicates the kind of this node and which field ( or ) is meaningful.

member.name: M:BlazingStory.Types.NavigationTreeOrderEntry.#ctor(System.Collections.Generic.IList{BlazingStory.Types.NavigationTreeOrderEntry})

member.name: M:BlazingStory.Types.StoryContext.ConvertParameterValueToString(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary:
Convert the given parameter value to a string.
If the value is an instance of or , this method returns the string that will be rendered by that render fragment.
If the value is an instance of , this method returns "(null)" if the value is null.
member.param: The name of the parameter.
The value of the parameter.
member.returns: The string representation of the parameter value.
